title: HoistField Single Message Transform
description: Configuration schema for HoistField transformation. Hoists a nested field to the top level of the record.

type.description: The transformation type. Use 'org.apache.kafka.connect.transforms.HoistField$Key' for key transformation or 'org.apache.kafka.connect.transforms.HoistField$Value' for value transformation.
type.title: type

field.description: The nested field name to hoist to the top level. Use dot notation for nested fields (e.g., 'user.name').
field.title: field

defaultSnippets.label: HoistField - Hoist nested field
defaultSnippets.description: Move a nested field to the top level. Use dot notation for nested fields (e.g., 'user.name'). Replace with your actual nested field path.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**HoistField** - Move a nested field to the top level of the record.

Use dot notation for nested fields (e.g., `user.name`). Replace with your actual nested field path.

**Example:** `{user: {name: "John"}}` → `{name: "John"}`

**Use case:** Simplify record structure when you only need a specific nested field.

defaultSnippets.label: HoistField - Hoist deeply nested field
defaultSnippets.description: Move a deeply nested field to the top level. Supports multiple levels of nesting. Replace with your actual nested field path.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**HoistField** - Move a deeply nested field to the top level.

Supports multiple levels of nesting. Replace with your actual nested field path.

**Example:** `{metadata: {timestamp: {created: 1234567890}}}` → `{created: 1234567890}`

**Use case:** Extract deeply nested fields for easier access in downstream systems.
